meanings.definition: A defensive work consisting of a protected trench or ditch.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers dug deep entrenchments to protect themselves from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered the construction of entrenchments along the border.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels built tiny entrenchments around their acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like an impenetrable entrenchment, guarding her heart.
meanings.sent5: The castle's entrenchments were so well-built that no one could breach them.

meanings.definition: The act of establishing something firmly or securely.
meanings.sent1: The company's success was due to the entrenchments of trust they had with their customers.
meanings.sent2: The entrenchments of democracy in the country were slowly eroding.
meanings.sent3: His entrenchments of routine were so strong, he couldn't adapt to change.
meanings.sent4: The entrenchments of tradition held strong against modern influences.
meanings.sent5: She relied on the entrenchments of her faith to get through tough times.
